did.abstract: One volume of quarterly conference minutes for the Catharine Circuit (1819-1847), a class book for the first class in Johnson's Settlement (1833-1839) listing members' attendance, and a record book (1852-1882) of the Catharine Sunday School Association.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Methodist Episcopal Society organized in 1805 met in private homes until 1809 when a church building was erected. In 1834 a new building was constructed. Catharine was the center of Johnson's Settlement which the records indicate was a pivotal charge on the Catherine circuit. At vaious times the circuit also included: Newtown (Elmira), Hector, McIntyre's Settlement, North Settlement, Newtown Creek, Jefferson, Veteran, Horseheads, Dean's Corners and Newfield.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one volume of Quarterly Conference meeting minutes from the Catharine circuit (1819-1847), a class book for the first class in Johnson's settlement (1833-39), and a record book from the Catharine Sunday School Society (1852-1882).

scopecontent.p: Minutes record attendance (president, secretary, circuit preachers, local preachers, leaders and stewards), an accounting of money collected, baptisms performed (name, parents, date and place of birth, date and officiator of baptism), occasional resolutions and disciplinary cases and reports from Sunday Schools. Items of note include:
Subscription clips and a report of a baptism in 1797.
Minutes commence.
Plans are made to provide a parsonage, (note: discussion of a parsonage and paying for it continue throughout most of the volume) .
Trial for abuse of family, lying and misrepresentation.
Resolved to join with the Ithaca Conference to hold a camp meeting in Danby on August 19th.
Voted to accept the constitution of the Methodist Tract Society.
Resolved that each class leader keep a subscription book of what each person pays.
Resolved to form Sabbath schools at the different towns on the circuit if practicable. Br. Pearsall is appointed.
Resolved to use the influence of the conference to enforce the observance of the Rule of Discipline related to the use of ardent spirits.
Voted to hold a camp meeting with Southport, Painted Post and Elmira in Veteran in June.
No minutes. A list of classes with their contributions for 1834 follows (Appears regularly hereafter).
First meeting at the new meeting house in Havana.
Resolved that circuit preachers take collections for the support of missions.
Request that the general conference restore Wesley's original rule in regard to the use of ardent spirits.
Statement on discipline.
Last entry.
History of a store in Catharine.

did.unittitle: Class book for the 1st Class in Johnson's Settlement for the year 1833", 1833-1839

scopecontent.p: The volume contains a numbered list of members and their state in church and society; includes: their state in life, and their attendance for specific dates (1833-1839). At the end of the volume there follows a list of subscriptions (n.d.) and a list of members received on trial.

Includes constitution, by-laws and minutes of the Catharine Sunday School Association auxiliary to the Sunday School Union of the Methodist Episcopal Church. Annual minutes record the election of officers, the appointment of teachers, a financial report and the appointment and reports of committees.
